ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: how to best evaluate and develop a biotechnology that is catered to a particular group of people/culture, history of various biotechnologies, efficacy and importance of various biotechonologies

I learned a lot about how best to address biotechnological challenges in lower-resource settings. We were able to think through many scenarios and considerations in different locations in order to understand how a technology might be received by a site's population.
I learned a lot about the developing world and what it is like to implement scientific innovations there. Worked in groups to produce meaningful projects.
I learned a more nuanced understanding of the problems actually experienced by the regions of the world we ascribe the term "developing" too.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
strength: passionate, knowledgeable, and understandable professor, discussion based formatting
weakness: timeliness of grading assignments

Strength: Engaging lectures, engaging projects, engaging everything! If I could recommend this class to any student at Yale, I would. I just loved the class.

Weakness: I have no complaints.
Phenomenal class.
This course does a good job of giving students activities throughout the semester to engage with!

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The lecture/discussion format of the class was great. However, this class required collaboration and getting to know your classmates in order to form an adequate group for the final project. The online format of the course disallowed us to fully know our classmates and therefore find suitable partners on our own for this project.
Successful in every way.
I think this course was pretty well done in spite of the virtual format. I feel like I really got to know and appreciate my group members especially.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes, I would recommend this course to any student interested in solutions to developing world health issues, or biotechnology at large. This class did not require immense knowledge of biotechnology to enter/succeed in the course, and therefore is a great beginner/intro course for those interested in this subject matter. Professor Gonzalez gave us a large amount in autonomy in choosing out project topics, so students who are self-starters and who have a genuine curiosity in this subject matter will enjoy the course.

Absolutely! This course is wonderful and Prof. Gonzalez is even more wonderful. The class is engaging, lectures are interesting, and you learn to approach biotechnology in various ways. I'm not even a bioengineering major and I loved this class.
YES! A phenomenal course with a phenomenal instructor.
Yes
Yes, I think this is a great course especially for STEM students who are looking for important, real-world applications for the things they have studied in other courses.
absolutely

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: weekly reading/homework assignments, midterm and final projects
N/A
We also received virtual lectures in addition to having virtual presentations/discussions/seminar etc.
